review: AWFUL.I've never been less satisfied with a product/service.First off, the fire stick always has to be plugged in. You can't charge it and use it wireless. It often says there's no internet connection while saying the connection is strong (the wifi is 10 feet from my tv)."Free" shipping: Free two day shipping is great around Christmas but otherwise it's unnecessary. I will often find items cheaper for non-prime customers. I'll then log in and the price is higher for a prime member.Streaming video: the movie selection is God awful. They claim there's so much of a selection but they design the service so you can't browse the entire collection. TV show selections are great.Kindle library: you can't use this service if you're an ipad owner. I'm not going out and buying a kindle.I'd advise to choose another streaming device like Apple TV or chromecast although I have no experience with either.

review: So I'm an Apple guy, and I have an AppleTV on every TV in the house. Why do I have a Fire stick and why do I love it? It all boils to two things.First, I have a Prime membership, and I had not watched one movie or TV episode in the last two years of having Prime. I can't watch it on an AppleTV, but now I have access to all the Prime content from the place I actually want to watch it. All the content I have through Apple I have to pay for, but this is content I have access to bundled into the price of a Prime membership I would have anyway. The range of content seems to be growing, so for now I'm not bored.Second, it works like a charm. The internet speeds in my area are not great, sometimes our access slows way down, which stinks for a family that has all their content in the cloud. The Apple TV will often sit there for a while waiting to buffer before it plays. This can sometimes say the expected wait is 20 or 30 minutes. The Fire Stick however will buffer as it goes, and will display a compressed video until it can catch up to HD, then automatically switches over to brilliant 1080. This is an awesome feature when you want to watch the next episode of How I Met Your Mother, and you don't want to wait for the buffering. One other nice feature, speaking of TV episodes, is that you can hit play once and it will keep playing right into the next episode - Apple makes you select the next episode manually - not a big deal, but super convenient for binge watchers.
